questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph on "Healthy Food and Junk Food".

sub_questions.explanation:
Healthy Food and Junk Food
Food is very important for survival. We eat food to get energy and stay healthy. There are two types of food: healthy food and junk food. Healthy food is good for our body. It helps us grow, keeps our body strong, and protects us from diseases. Healthy food includes fruits, vegetables, milk, eggs, fish, meat, and nuts. These foods give vitamins, minerals, and&proteins that are necessary for our body. Children who eat healthy food can study well, play actively, and stay energetic. On the other hand, junk food is not good for our body. Junk food includes fast food like burgers, fries, chips, cakes, soft drinks, and sweets. Junk food has too much fat, sugar, and salt, If we eat it often, it can make us weak, fat, and sick. It can also harm our teeth and stomach. Children who eat too much junk food may feel tired and lazy. We should eat healthy food most of the time and avoid junk food. Many of us eat junk food on special occasions, like birthdays or parţies. Of course, we should not eat too much. It is true that healthy food and exercise together keep our body fit and active. Parents should teach children to choose healthy food and make them aware of the bad effects of junk food. In conclusion, healthy food makes us strong and smart, while junk food can make us weak and ill. So, we should eat more healthy food and avoid junk food to lead a happy and healthy life.

questions.uddipok: Suppose you are Sadiq/Sadika and study in class X in Adamdighi Adorsha High School, Dhaka. Now write an application to your Headmistress for permission to arrange a "Tree Plantation Program" in your school premises.

10 February 2026
The Headmaster
Adamdighi Adorsha High School
Dhaka

Subject: Application for permission to arrange a tree plantation programme
Sir,
This is to inform you that we are keenly interested to arrange a tree plantation programme in our school. It can give us an opportunity to make everyone aware of the importance of planting trees. Moreover,, they will learn the severe impacts of cutting down trees indiscriminately. It is, no doubt, a noble programme in which the students will participate spontaneously. Such a move to maintain ecological balance is essential for the common benefits of humans and animals.
Therefore, we would like to request you to grant our prayer and oblige us thereby.

Obediently yours,
Sadika
On behalf of the students of
Adamdighi Adorsha High School

Food Adulteration
Food is essential for our life. We eat food to stay healthy, grow well, and have energy for work and study. But nowadays, food adulteration has become a big problem in Bangladesh and all over the world. Food adulteration means the act of intentionally lowering the quality or purity of food by adding, removing or substituting ingredients in a way that makes the food unsafe, impure and less valuable. Sometimes, sellers mix harmful chemicals, artificial colors, or other materials in food to increase profit. This is very dangerous for human health.
Common examples of food adulteration include mixing starch in milk, adding chemicals in sweets, adding artificial colors to fruits and vegetables, and mixing water in oil. Many people do this to make more money. Unfortunately, people often buy these foods without knowing the harmful effects of them. Eating adulterated food can cause many diseases such as stomach problems, food poisoning, kidney diseases, and even cancer. Particularly, children, old people, and patients are more affected by adulterated food.
It is the responsibility of both the government and conscious people to stop food adulteration. Government authorities should check shops and markets regularly and punish those who sell adulterated or harmful food. People should also be careful while buying food. They should buy fresh and natural food, read labels, and avoid artificial or cheap-looking products. We should also spread awareness about the bad effects of adulterated food among our family, friends, and neighbors. Healthy food is necessary for a strong body and a sharp mind. Only by avoiding adulterated food we can live a healthy life and protect ourselves from diseases. In conclusion, food adulteration is a serious problem as it is generally related to health issue of the nation. We must fight against it and eat pure, healthy, and natural food to stay strong, active, and healthy.
